publication.title: A Congestion Control Method Jointly Utilizing Delay and Marking/Loss Feedback
publication.keyword: Congestion Control;Dynamic Networks;Indexing Terms;Network Calculus;Network Congestion;Packet Loss;Packet Marking;Tcp Vegas;High Throughput;
publication.abstract: Depending upon the type of feedback that is utilized, network congestion control schemes can be classified into two cat - egories: marking/loss based (e.g., TCP Reno) or delay based (e.g., TCP Vegas). Delay-based schemes have garnered much attention due to their higher network throughput than loss-based methods. Delay provides a much finer-grained measure of congestion than packet loss or packet

publication.title: TCP congestion avoidance: a network calculus interpretation and performance improvements
Delay-based TCP congestion avoidance: A network calculus interpretation and performance improvements
Normalized queueing delay: congestion control jointly utilizing delay and marking
publication.authors: xingzhe fan,manohar n. murthi,t. dilusha wickramarathna,kamal premaratne
